intro: Commiphora cuneifolia, commonly known as the African myrrh, is a small, deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes other resin-producing plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It produces a fragrant resin, which has been used traditionally for medicinal and aromatic purposes. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
